alert.note: Alert for Sussex (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 17 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwestern Sussex County in southern Delaware. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 130 PM EDT, minor flooding was occurring along the Nanticoke River and some of its tributaries in northwestern Sussex County, including the Bridgeville area. Between 4 and 6 inches of rain fell in that area on Sunday. - The waterways are forecast to return within their banks this evening. - For the Nanticoke River at Bridgeville: At 1:15 pm the river level was 9.59 feet and cresting. Flood Stage is 9.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
